data.title: Running Tours Rock
data.text: This was a great way to see the city quickly. It gave me and my family a way to see a bit of everything and later we went to see more at the stops we were more interested in. They also shared some fun things going on in the city such as the evening laser art display on the Cathedral of San Fernando (which was amazing and we wouldn't have known about any other way). We also went to the Manger Hotel after their suggestion and got Mango Ice-Cream, because they told us a fun story about Bill Clinton and buying a lot of this ice-cream after his presidential win.  It was really fun and another unique experience we would have otherwise not had.

data.title: Awesome activity
data.text: I did the River City Run this past Saturday. It was a fantastic time.. The tour guides were great and very knowledgeable.. overall a great time.. I can't wait to come back to San Antonio and do it again.

data.title: 😍San Antonio❤️
data.text: It was totally awsome so beautiful 😍 love San Antonio Texas, very nice place to enjoy the walk diferent cultures...Foods Hotels The River Mall Awsome!!!I recomend 💯

data.title: Great way to see San Antonio
data.text: A fun friendly experience with a knowledgeable guide. Well worth the price. Good way for active solo travelers like me to see the city.

data.title: River City Run (October 8, 2016)
data.text: Had a wonderful time!!!  Tour guides did a great job!!!  Will definitely sign up for another run/tour!!!

data.title: River City Run
data.text: I would like to thank Tina and Tom for this run. My wife, son and I all really enjoyed our time. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to get out and explore downtown. The run was very informative and has sparked some new interests in places we want to visit as a family.

data.title: Fun tour! A San Antonio must for runners.
data.text: We had a wonderful tour with a fun group to share the experience. Tina and Tom were fantastic guides . Really enjoyed our day.

data.title: See the Home of the Alamo in an awesome way with your family!
data.text: This was the first time participating in the jogging tour of San Antonio which was great! I signed myself and nephew up for this and am so happy that we did this and are ready to join this group again when am next in town! Tina is just great to work with in setting up the run and attends to everyone's needs on the run. I grew up in San Antonio, but seeing it by foot this way and areas that you cannot access by car or haven't seen in years is really fabulous to do! We learned some more facts and historical aspects and my nephew enjoyed it all. This is a great run to do with children and fantastic that it involves exercise. Am glad that River City Run is getting people moving and appreciating the Alamo city - thank you!

data.title: Great Run and Great Sites
data.text: I did a private tour run with Tina on 9/27/16.  Tina was great and I felt like I was running with a very knowledgeable friend.  It was traveling for business, so it was a great way to fit in a workout and see a little of the city at the same time.  This run really made my day.

data.title: Awesome Guides, Historic sites and Great workout!
data.text: Tina and Kelly were our guides and they were AWESOME - very friendly and informative.  I learned a lot about the city while also able to get a nice workout in!  I definitely would recommend this to anyone visiting the city.  The earlier you do this in your trip, the better, that way you can visit some or all of the neat sites you're exposed to throughout your stay!

data.title: Highly recommend - Great way to see the major San Antonio sights!
data.text:
This was such a fun way to get to see the major San Antonio sights as well as hear about its history - I have been to San Antonio before and done the major attraction tours, but I still learned so much! 

The guide I had was great - she was super personable and friendly with all the other runners. She seemed to not only know a ton about San Antonio's history and neat little facts about random little features I bet many of us would walk by without even noticing, but she also seemed to know a lot of the local people we ran by too - I thought that was a nice touch, it made the experience of touring San Antonio feel so much more friendly.

The run is formatted so it can accommodate a whole bunch of running paces... we were stopping pretty frequently, which allowed the whole spread of running paces to stay together. 

Apparently other cities have running tours too, and after this experience I will definitely try and make a point to do it again when traveling... I just hope they are as friendly, informative and interesting as this tour was. Thank you River City Run for the amazing tour - I cannot recommend "y'all" highly enough!

data.title: Private Tour - Great way to get in your training run and see San Antonio!
data.text: I've lived in San Antonio my whole life and am currently training for the Rock N Roll 1/2 Marathon in December.  While looking for running routes downtown I discovered River City Run and thought this would be a fun way to learn more about the city while getting in a training run.  My friend and I booked a private 7 mile tour and we weren't disappointed.  We met at Hotel Emma and ran along the River Walk (Downtown and Museum Reach) and into Brackenridge Park.  Our guide was encouraging, ensured we were running at a comfortable pace, and shared lots of fun places I look forward to visiting in the future.

data.title: 8 min miles is not "jogging"
data.text:
My husband and I traveled with another couple to San Antonio. We were very excited to do this history run. Unfortunately, the website is very misleading in the experience level needed for the race. It is definitely not "jogging". My husband runs marathons and he kept track on his watch - the tour guide was running 8 minute miles. This was not a problem for him, but it was for me. I eventually had to leave the group because I could only jog. Eventually they were so far ahead of us that the guide wouldn't wait anymore. I wanted my husband to enjoy it so I encouraged him to go ahead. Another member in our group made it to the end, but said she really struggled due to the pace. He usually runs 9 min miles so this tour was way too fast. And she even runs races!  

The guide started off so extremely fast that it was not enjoyable for several people. She was often out of breath when trying to explain one of the sites. She would tell history while we were waiting at at busy intersections waiting for the light to change. We could not figure out what the extreme rush was for. The stops were NOT 3-4 min. 

There was a lot of jaywalking and rushing with the information being told. We also thought it was in poor taste she mentioned she was an attorney multiple times.... And if we got caught jay walking, she could get us out of the ticket. 

The idea and concept of this history race is really unique and awesome. I just wish they offered it in 2 different levels. There needs to be a level for those who cannot run 7-8 minute miles. Maybe 9-10 minute miles? Which is what I would consider jogging? Perhaps make an an actual race (or whatever the guide was trying to do) for those wanting to run that fast.

owner_response.author: Tina S, Owner at River City Run, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for River City Run and for bringing your experience to our attention. I apologize that we didn't deliver the experience you were expecting.  The goal is for runners of all abilities to enjoy this active tour together while learning about the wonderful city of San Antonio.  If you would please contact me via email (rivercityrunsa@gmail.com) I would like to hear more about your experience.  I also hope that if you have the chance to visit San Antonio in the future you will give us another chance.  

Kindest Regards,

Tina Stolhandske
210-201-3786
rivercityrunsa@gmail.com
Owner and Tour Guide
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun and informative
data.text: Our guide was knowledgeable and fun. The running route was beautiful. The pace was a little too fast for my wife, but we caught up at traffic lights and other stops.

data.title: Work out and learn
data.text: Great time.  Vanessa was a great tour guide.  Get to see parts of Sam Antonio you wouldn't normally see and tips on what to do later.

data.title: Saturday AM Run
data.text: I had a blast!  The guide was extremely informative and even guided me to the location, as I was driving around lost trying to find the Alamo.  She waited for me to get there, very thoughtful!  I will definitely like to do this run several more times and already talking people into running it with me. Thank you so very much!!

data.title: RiverCity Run
data.text: Excellent adventure.  I am not a runner; however, I was still able to keep up. My spouse, grandsons (8 and 10), and friends from work participated.  Learned new things about San Antonio.   Interesting and informative.   I would highly recommend!

data.title: What a wonderful way to discover San Antonio
data.text:
I love running, so when I was given the gift of going to San Antonio, the first thing I did was google running activities. I came across River City run and without hesitation I booked the run for my boyfriend and I. What a great experience, to be able to run through the city while learning of its history. When I go back next year, I am definitely doing it again. If you are going to visit San Antonio, River City Run is a must do on your list...Thank you for making our morning fun :)

Dirlayne

data.title: River City Fun!
data.text: Great morning and fun way to learn history.  Our guide was personable and friendly.  Would definitely recommend!

data.title: Informative, fun, good company, bucket list,  experience!
data.text: I love exploring history and places I've never been. This morning I joined a running tour in the great city of San Antonio, were a group of strangers ran together and stopped throughout the run to learn about the history of many amazing places! Our guides were awesome and made it a great experience full of sweat courtesy of the Texas heat, if your ever in San Antonio check out River City Run!
